title: Citibank Korea Donates $260,000 to Support Women Entrepreneurs
summary: Seoul - Citibank Korea has signed an agreement with the Korea Small Business Institute (KOSBI) to donate $260,000 to the 2012 Citi-KOSBI Women's Entrepreneurship Program.
tag-1: Citibank Korea Donates $260,000 to Support Women Entrepreneurs
tag-2: Seoul – Citibank Korea has signed an agreement with the Korea Small Business Institute (KOSBI) to donate $260,000 to the 2012 Citi-KOSBI Women's Entrepreneurship Program.
tag-3: Citibank Korea CEO Ha Yung-Ku, Division Head Choi, Soo-Gyu of the Small and Medium Business Administration and Chairperson Jeon, Soo-Hye of the Korean Women Entrepreneurs Association attended the signing ceremony on April 3, 2012, at the KOSBI Building, Yoido, along with program organizers and women entrepreneurs who are participants of the program.
tag-4: The program was developed in 2007 and launched in 2008 through funding from the Citi Foundation with the goal of identifying role models for women-led SMEs and enhancing their competitiveness through trainings and networking. This year, the funding will go towards the Citi-KOSBI Women-Owned Enterprise Academy, the Citi-KOSBI Women Entrepreneurs' Award, and networking between women business owners and college students aspiring to run their own startups at home and abroad.
tag-5: "I expect this program will continue to help to foster as many competitive women-owned businesses as possible," said Chairperson Jeon, Soo-Hye.
tag-6: Addressing the women entrepreneurs at the signing ceremony, Citi Korea CEO Ha said, "I hope that the business knowledge and networking that you gain from this program will help you grow your business and become role-models for women entrepreneurs."
tag-7: The Citi-KOSBI Women's Entrepreneurship Program is targeted at CEOs and middle managers of women-led SMEs (small and medium enterprises) and will run from April 3 through July 10, 2012, at the KOSBI office in Yoido. This 14-week program, covering 21 subjects, including leadership, global competence, fun management, business innovation and SME governmental finance, will help to enhance the job capabilities and innovative business ideas of these women. Tuition fees for each program participant will be fully funded by the Citi Foundation.
tag-8: The signing ceremony was followed by the opening ceremony of the fifth Citi-KOSBI Women-Owned Enterprise Academy.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
